channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-23713] SavepointITCase.testStopWithSavepointWithDrainGlobalFailoverIfSavepointAborted failed with "Stop with savepoint operation could not be completed"
item.description:

item.summary: SavepointITCase.testStopWithSavepointWithDrainGlobalFailoverIfSavepointAborted failed with "Stop with savepoint operation could not be completed"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: pnowojski could this be caused by the recent work on FLIP-147?

I can not reproduce this locally. I have submitted a PR to rethrow the original exception because "org.apache.flink.util.FlinkException: Stop with savepoint operation could not be completed." doesn't tell us much. If I won't be able to reproduce it locally, we will need to wait for a next occurrence on azure after merging my PR.
I couldn't reproduce it locally after a couple of hours. Merged improvement in the tests as 938cf8d into apache:master. Let's hope for a next failure to give a better message.

After second investigation my previous fix hasn't improved anything in this regard. This exception without any stack trace is being thrown from:
org.apache.flink.runtime.scheduler.adaptive.StopWithSavepoint#onLeave.

There might be more information in the logs.

The problem is reproducible when enabling the adaptive scheduler. The problem is that the test tests for a specific exception message that is an implementation detail of the default scheduler but not the adaptive scheduler. That's why the test fails.
